Title: Experiment Report
Text:
I. Objectives
1. Assess the feasibility of spore essence extraction.
2. Investigate the diverse effects of spores at different concentrations.
II. Materials
Hoochiefs, with one uncontaminated and one contaminated specimen per group; 1ml syringe, saline solution.
III. Procedure
1. Group two Hoochiefs with similar body weights, weigh them, and assign unique identifiers.
2. Extract spore essence from contaminated individuals, blend it with saline solution, and establish concentrations of 0.2%, 0.4%, and 0.8%, categorized by groups.
3. Administer various concentrations of the spore extracts to uncontaminated individuals, observe their activity, and record findings.
4. After completing the experiment, conduct statistical analysis on the results and formulate conclusions.
IV. Conclusions
1. The spore essence extraction process results in approximately 58% loss, but extraction remains viable.
2. The 0.4% concentration of the extract exhibits the optimal effect, although outcomes may differ based on subjects and necessitate further validation.

Note: Achieved interim success. Transitioning the experimental subjects to humans is authorized.
